Event.name: Change_tool
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> changes <fen>Tools</fen>, from the <fen>Old_tool</fen> to a <fen>New_tool</fen>. The <fen>Tools</fen> may include vehicles, services providers, or more proto-typical implements.
<ex>If this happens one more time, <fex name="age">we</fex> 're going to <t>switch</t> <fex name="tos">operating systems</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="age">Stephen</fex> had to <t>transfer</t> <fex name="ite">five times</fex> <fex name="tim">by the time he got to Lincolnville</fex>. <fex name="tos">DNI</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a change.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The aim of the <fen>Agent</fen> when they carry out the change. </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> acts intentionally.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The action of the <fen>Agent</fen> which brings about a change.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s change which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
</def-root>

Arg.name: Tools
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entities controlled by an Agent to achieve some Purpose.</def-root>

Arg.name: Old_tool
Arg.definition: <def-root>The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> had been using.</def-root>

Arg.name: New_tool
Arg.definition: <def-root>The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> ends up using.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The number of times that the action goes from start to finish.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: change.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: discontinue use of and begin use of another

lexUnit.name: transfer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: change to another place, route, or means of transport during a journey.

lexUnit.name: switch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: change affiliation (to a provider of a service)

lexUnit.name: swap.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: exchange one tool for another available tool.

lexUnit.name: trade.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: switch one item (tool, accessory, etc.) for another.
